Description: Sherd of rim, neck and shoulder of South Ionian pottery krater; interior reserved save for band at top; key maeander band on top of rim between bands; outside and underside glazed; on neck, probable handle area to left with large solid square and pairs of verticals to its right; on the right metopal frieze of assorted maeander and squares filled with dots; two bands at turn to shoulder; on shoulder only three dots preserved.
Curator's comments: Nadine Pantaleon dates this to post-580 BC (Die Kratere der archaische Zeit aus Naukratis, unpublished dissertation, Bochum, 2011, 283, Naukr.3).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.018)
